channel.title: Lexical scope on Today I Learned
channel.description: Recent content in Lexical scope on Today I Learned

item.title: Scopes & Closures
item.description: Lexical Scopes The part of a program where a binding between a variable and value is valid (variables are only available under certain circumstances with different languages having different access rules). Describes the regions in my code where I can refer to a variable by name without getting access errors. Defining a function creates a new lexical scope It is a collection of key-value pairs, but is not an object - except the global context object.
